[[Pilot error]] is seen as a possible cause of the crash. [http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/36352097/ns/world_news-europe/ (MSNBC)] [http://www.vesti.ru/ (\u0412\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0438; ''Russian'')] [http://lenta.ru/news/2010/04/10/cause/ (lenta.ru; ''Russian'')]\n**The plane was flying from [[Warsaw]] to mark the 70th anniversary of the [[Katyn massacre]]. So far, there are no reports of fatalities or injuries. The storm, which weakened to Category 3 status with 125 mph sustained winds, is expected to dump up to 25 inches (63.5 centimeters) of rain in some location before it moves away from the islands. [https://web.archive.org/web/20151008002751/http://www.sacbee.com/news/nation-world/article37293927.html (AP via Sacramento Bee)] [https://news.yahoo.com/hurricane-joaquin-upgraded-category-four-us-forecasters-181105118.html (AFP via Yahoo News)]\n**Joaquin is slowly moving on an east/northeast trek lowering the possibility of  a direct hit to the U.S. East Coast. Adding Joaquin's wind and rain could create deadly, unprecedented downpours, flooding, wind damage, and power outages. If confirmed, the deaths would be the first Russian military casualties since intervening in the civil war in September. A U.S. military official said the deployment had \"added capability\" to the [[Combined Joint Task Force \u2013 Operation Inherent Resolve|coalition's efforts]] against [[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|ISIL]] in [[Iraq]] and [[Syria]]. [https://news.yahoo.com/canada-withdrawing-fighter-jets-iraq-syria-trudeau-tells-220007010.html (AFP via Yahoo)]\n*[[War in Afghanistan (2001\u2013present)]]\n**The [[Taliban]] kill 22 policemen and kidnap 19 others, including the district\u2019s security chief, during clashes with [[Afghan Armed Forces|Afghan troops]] who kill 12 of the insurgents in the battle in [[Faryab Province]] in northern [[Afghanistan]]. [https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/21/world/asia/afghanistan-taliban-police-ghormach.html?_r=0 (New York Times)] [http://www.laht.com/article.asp?ArticleId=2398477&CategoryId=12395 (Latin American Herald Tribune)]\n**Taliban forces advance on [[Lashkar Gah]], the capital of [[Helmand Province]] in southern Afghanistan, amid fierce fighting with government forces that threatens to cut off a major highway and has prompted many families to flee. [[United States Department of Defense|The Pentagon]]<!--The Pentagon is the building, but is being used as a metonym for DoD.--> said the agreement will remain [[Secret treaty|secret]]; a [[hotline]] will enable both countries to directly communicate. [http://www.cbsnews.com/news/russian-american-deal-on-syrian-air-space-expected-shortly/?google_editors_picks=true (CBS News)] [http://www.upi.com/Top_News/World-News/2015/10/20/US-Russia-sign-deal-to-avoid-conflict-between-warlanes-over-Syria/7661445365741/ (UPI)]\n*[[Prime Minister of Israel|Israeli Prime Minister]] [[Benjamin Netanyahu]], in tonight's speech to the [[World Zionist Congress]] on \"the 10 big lies\" told by [[Palestinians]] and their backers, said [[Amin al-Husseini|Haj Amin al-Husseini]], the [[Grand Mufti of Jerusalem]] from 1922\u20131937, convinced [[Adolf Hitler]] and the [[Nazi Party|Nazis]] to change their original plan of expelling Jews to the so-called [[Final Solution]], i.e., the extermination of Jews. ''The Washington Post'' states this reinforces Netanyahu's [[Amin al-Husseini#The Holocaust|position that Palestinian violence is caused by their old and intractable hatred of Jews]], not [[Israel|Israel's]] 1948 creation. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/netanyahu-says-a-palestinian-gave-hitler-the-idea-for-the-holocaust/2015/10/21/0a36d7da-ee8b-4135-9726-968eceda4cc9_story.html (Washington Post)]\n\n;Law and crime\n*The [[Israel Defense Forces]] arrest senior [[Hamas]] leader Sheikh [[Hassan Yousef]] for alleged incitement to commit violence. [http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/IDF-arrests-senior-Hamas-figure-Hassan-Yousef-in-West-Bank-427478 (''Jerusalem Post'')]\n*A [[Prosecutor#France|French public prosecutor]] said charges against [[Far-right politics|far-right leader]] [[Marine Le Pen]] should be dropped. Le Pen is being tried for comments she made five years ago comparing [[Salah#The five daily prayers|Muslim street prayers]] to [[German military administration in occupied France during World War II|Nazi occupation]]. Prosecutor Bernard Reynaud said, \u201cMadame Le Pen in denouncing prayers in public space addressed not the entire Muslim community but a minority and was only exercising her [[Freedom of speech|freedom of expression]].\u201d [http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/10/20/french-prosecutor-calls-to-drop-racism-charges-against-far-right-leader.html (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/20/us-france-politics-lepen-idUSKCN0SE1XS20151020 (Reuters)]\n\n;Politics and elections\n*[[Democratic Party presidential candidates, 2016]]\n**Former Virginia [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Jim Webb]] announces his withdrawal from the race for the [[Democratic Party presidential candidates, 2016|Democratic presidential nomination]] during a press conference at the [[National Press Club]]. He added that he would consider his other options in the coming weeks. Webb's campaign said he is weighing an independent bid. [http://www.nbcnews.com/politics/2016-election/jim-webb-quit-democratic-primary-n447736 (NBC News)] [http://bigstory.ap.org/article/b5d02ee2e7e0407c94748817f17d7c40/webb-considering-dropping-democratic-bid-president (AP)] [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/post-politics/wp/2015/10/20/webb-exits-democratic-presidential-primary/ (Washington Post)]\n\n;Science\n*Research from [[University of California, Los Angeles]] scientists indicates that life on earth may have started 4.1 billion years ago \u2013 300 million years earlier than previously thought. [http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/science/life-on-earth-may-have-started-4-1-billion-years-ago/articleshow/49464944.cms (''Economic Times'')]\n*Research by the [[University of Central Florida]] indicates a common [[Ultraviolet|UV]]-filtering compound, [[oxybenzone]], found in [[Sunscreen|sunscreen lotion]] is killing [[coral]], especially among reefs frequented by [[Recreational diving|recreational divers]] and [[Snorkeling|snorkelers]]. [http://www.upi.com/Science_News/2015/10/20/Sunscreen-chemicals-may-be-killing-coral-reefs-popular-with-tourists/1721445351385/?spt=hts&or=4 (UPI)] [http://time.com/4082272/coral-reefs-sunscreen-oxybenzone/ (Time)]\n\n;Sports\n*[[Lamar Odom]], who had been hospitalized in grave condition after ingesting, in a binge, herbal Viagra, alcohol, and other substances in a 3-day, $75,000 stay at a legal brothel in Nevada, comes out of his coma, improves, and is able to have conversations, though he is still on [[dialysis]] to deal with the renal damage he suffered. He is released from intensive care and [[Sunrise Hospital]], to a hospital closer to his [[Los Angeles]] home. [https://web.archive.org/web/20151022164334/http://www.msn.com/en-us/sports/nba/lamar-odom-reportedly-released-from-las-vegas-hospital/ar-AAfDudF?li=BBgzzfc&ocid=iehp (MSN via Sporting News)]\n<!-- All news items above this line -->|}"}

[http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/10/20/residents-in-isis-de-facto-capital-fear-military-conscription.html (Al Jazeera America)]\n*[[Yemeni Civil War (2015\u2013present)]]\n**Rockets fired by [[Houthis|Houthi]] forces reportedly kill 14 people in city of [[Taiz]], southwestern [[Yemen]]. [https://news.yahoo.com/20-shot-dead-suspected-islamists-ne-nigeria-witnesses-224347258.html (AFP via Yahoo)]\n\n;Disasters and accidents\n*[[2015 Pacific typhoon season]]\n**The death toll from [[Typhoon Koppu (2015)|Tropical Storm Koppu]] that battered the [[Philippines|Philippines']] main island this weekend climbed to at least 39. Koppu forced more than 100,000 villagers into [[Emergency shelter|emergency shelters]] and destroyed [[Paddy field|rice fields]] ready for [[harvest]]. [http://bigstory.ap.org/article/a6780727882643e38f1ecee125a19dd0/death-toll-tropical-storm-philippines-climbs-39 (AP)] [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-34590520 (BBC)]\n*A [[United States|U.S.]] [[F-18 Super Hornet|F-18]] fighter jet [[List of accidents and incidents involving military aircraft (2010\u2013present)|crashes]] into farmland near [[RAF Lakenheath]] in [[Suffolk]] county, [[England]], killing the pilot. [http://news.sky.com/story/1573566/pilot-killed-as-us-jet-crashes-in-huge-fireball (Sky News)]\n\n;Health and medicine\n*The [[American Academy of Pediatrics]] calls for pregnant women to abstain completely from alcohol during the entire three trimesters of the pregnancy, saying no amount of any type of alcohol should be considered safe since the risks, to the baby in particular (such as [[fetal alcohol syndrome]], among many others), are too great. This puts the U.S. alongside other Western developed countries- except [[Italy]] and the [[United Kingdom]], which still allow occasional small amounts- in urging complete abstinence. The [[American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists]] and the [[Centers for Disease Control and Prevention]] (CDC), the two other U.S. agencies that comment most about this issue, already recommend total alcohol abstinence. [http://www.cnn.com/2015/10/21/health/aap-no-alcohol-during-pregnancy/index.html (CNN)]\n\n;International relations\n*[[Syrian Civil War]]\n**The [[President of Syria]] [[Bashar al-Assad]] visits [[Moscow]] for talks with the [[President of Russia]] [[Vladimir Putin]] in an unannounced visit. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-34590561# (BBC)]\n*[[Supreme Leader of Iran|Iran's Supreme Leader]] [[Ali Khamenei|Ayatollah Ali Khamenei]] approves the nuclear deal between [[Government of Iran|Tehran]] and world powers, and orders it to be implemented subject to certain conditions. The letter states the [[United States]] and [[European Union]] should clearly announce the elimination of [[sanctions against Iran]]. The imposition of sanctions at any level and under any pretext from any of the negotiating countries would violate the [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action|JCPOA]]. [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/21/us-iran-nuclear-khamenei-idUSKCN0SF18720151021 (Reuters)] [http://en.mehrnews.com/news/111282/Leader-issues-important-orders-to-Rouhani-on-JCPOA (Mehr News Agency)] [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/wires/afp/article-3282784/Iran-leader-endorses-nuclear-deal-despite-ambiguities.html (Daily Mail)]\n*The [[Holy See|Vatican]] denies an [[Italy|Italian]] newspaper report that [[Pope Francis]] has a [[Benign tumor|benign brain tumour]], saying the 78-year-old pontiff is in good health, and denounces the article as utterly reprehensible. [http://in.reuters.com/article/2015/10/21/pope-tumor-denial-idINKCN0SF0I220151021 (Reuters)] [https://web.archive.org/web/20151022184430/http://www.philly.com/philly/news/nation_world/20151021_ap_d5009b7f244a45caba8107267fd5b0db.html (AP via Philly.com)]\n*[[Prime Minister of Israel|Israeli Prime Minister]] [[Benjamin Netanyahu|Benjamin Netanyahu's]] speech yesterday that the [[Amin al-Husseini|Grand Mufti of Jerusalem]] persuaded the [[Nazi Party|Nazis]] to adopt their [[Final Solution]] to exterminate 6 million [[Jews]] is reproached by [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]] experts and survivors, historians, world leaders, etc. [[Palestine Liberation Organization|Palestine Liberation Organization's]] [[Saeb Erakat]] and [[Israel|Israel's]] [[Zionist Union|Zionist Union party's]] [[Isaac Herzog]] both blasted Netanyahu's claim. [[Chancellor of Germany|German Chancellor]] [[Angela Merkel]] said, \"All Germans know the history of the murderous race mania of the Nazis that led to ... the Holocaust.\"  Mehnaz Afridi, a [[Manhattan College]] professor who promotes Muslim-Jewish dialogue said, \"this ... really is a terrible statement to make at this time.\" [http://time.com/4080962/netanyahu-palestinians-holocaust/?xid=gonewsedit&google_editors_picks=true (Time)] [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/10/21/israel-netanyahu-hitler-germany-idUSB4N11U01120151021 (Reuters)] [http://www.cnn.com/2015/10/21/middleeast/netanReactioyahu-hitler-grand-mufti-holocaust/ (CNN)]\n\n;Law and crime\n*Two [[China|Chinese]] [[Consul (representative)|consulate]] staff are killed and a consul general injured after a gunman opened fire on a restaurant in the [[Cebu City|city of Cebu]], the \"second city\" of the [[Philippines]]. Various reports named the gunman as Chinese national Li Qingliang. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/philippines/11945268/Two-Chinese-consulate-staff-killed-at-Philippine-restaurant.html (The Telegraph)] \n*[[St. Louis|St. Louis']] police chief announces officers are stepping up patrols following fires at six predominantly African-American churches in the past two weeks. No one has been injured in any of the fires. The reward for information leading to an arrest is now $4,000; the [[Metropolitan Police Department, City of St. Louis|St. Louis Police Officers\u2019 Association]] will match the $2,000 reward being offered by the St. Louis Regional Crime Stoppers and the [[Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives|ATF]]. The [[American Civil Liberties Union|American Civil Liberties Union of Missouri]] and the [[Anti-Defamation League]] suggest the fires may be arson sparked by racist motivations. [http://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/st-louis-police-add-patrols-trying-to-crack-string-of/article_26d2eb76-f517-5394-9a21-f31ccfdc024a.html (St. Louis Post-Dispatch)] [http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/six-fires-st-louis-churches-under-investigation-reward-offered-n447836 (NBC News)]\n*[[Wikileaks]] releases [[United States|U.S.]] [[Central Intelligence Agency]] director [[John O. Brennan|John O. Brennan's]] personal information after the top spy's personal [[email]] account was allegedly [[Hacker (computer security)|hacked]] by a 13-year-old and information sent to Wikileaks. All of the documents predate Brennan's time in the [[Presidency of Barack Obama|Obama administration]] and reveal no classified data. Among the information released are [[Social Security (United States)|Social Security]] [[Social Security number|numbers]],  an incomplete [[Single Scope Background Investigation|questionnaire]] for security clearance, and addresses of his family and associates. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-34597060 (BBC)] [http://www.cnn.com/2015/10/21/politics/john-brennan-hacked-cia-director/ (CNN)]\n*A [[United Kingdom|British]] lawyer and his wife are found dead by their gardener at their home on the [[Caribbean]] island of [[Tobago]]. The [[Trinidad and Tobago Police Service]] believe the couple were murdered during a suspected robbery. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/british-lawyer-and-wife-murdered-during-suspected-robbery-at-caribbean-home-a6703671.html (Independent)]\n\n;Politics and elections\n*[[2016 United States presidential election]]\n**[[Vice President of the United States|Vice President]] [[Joe Biden]] says that he will not be seeking the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] nomination. {"date": "2015-11-01", "source": "{{Current events header|2015|11|1}}\n\n<!-- All news items below this line -->\n;Armed conflicts and attacks\n*[[Somali Civil War (2009\u2013present)]]\n**Islamist [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] militants attack a hotel in [[Mogadishu]] resulting in at least 12 deaths. News)] [http://www.abc.net.au/news/2015-11-01/al-shabaab-militants-attack-hotel-in-somalia/6903432 (Reuters via ABC News Australia)]\n*[[Syrian Civil War]]\n**[[Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant|Islamic State]] fighters seize control of [[Mahin, Syria|Mahin]], a town in [[Syria]]'s central [[Homs Governorate|Homs]] province, following clashes with government forces which left about 50 dead. Fighting was also reported to be taking place on the outskirts of [[Sadad, Syria|Sadad]], a nearby town mostly populated by [[Christianity in Syria|Christians]]. [http://uk.reuters.com/article/2015/11/01/uk-mideast-crisis-syria-is-idUKKCN0SQ1I620151101 (Reuters)]\n*[[Israeli-Palestinian conflict (2015)]]\n**One [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] is killed and three [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] injured in two attacks in the [[West Bank]]. According to the Israeli army, the Palestinian was shot dead after attempting to stab soldiers at a military checkpoint near the [[Beit Einun]] village in [[Hebron]]. In a second incident in the same area,  a driver rammed and injured three [[Israel Border Police|Israeli paramilitary border policemen]] with his car before fleeing the scene.  None of the three were injured seriously. [http://www.dailystar.com.lb/Article.aspx?id=321129&link=News/Middle-East/2015/Nov-01/321129-3-israelis-police-hurt-in-west-bank-car-ramming-attack-police.ashx (The Daily Star)] [http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/10/31/israeli-forces-shoot-palestinian-who-allegedly-wielding-knife.html (Al Jazeera)]\n**Since the beginning of October, nine Israeli citizens, 67 Palestinian and an [[Arab citizens of Israel|Arab Israeli]] have been killed in this wave of violence. [https://news.yahoo.com/3-israeli-police-reported-hurt-west-bank-car-180154542.html (AFP via Yahoo News)]\n**The fate of slain Palestinians is fueling a new feud with Israeli authorities. The [[Ministry of Defense (Israel)|Israeli defense minister]] says Israel is refusing to return the bodies of Palestinian terrorists killed during this month-old surge of violence unless the Palestinian side agrees to keep their [[Islamic funeral|funerals]] \"modest.\"  [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/01/us-israel-palestinians-idUSKCN0SQ21H20151101 (Reuters)]\n**An [[Israel Defense Force]]s inquiry concludes the death of a Palestinian woman at a checkpoint in Hebron last month was unnecessary, finding the teenager could have been detained and not killed. [http://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/.premium-1.683193 (Haaretz)]\n;Disasters and accidents\n*The [[United States Navy]] sends a remotely operated underwater craft to investigate a wreck which they believe is the remains of the {{SS|El Faro}} which disappeared on October 1 near [[the Bahamas]] during [[Hurricane Joaquin]] with 33 people on board. [http://edition.cnn.com/2015/10/31/us/el-faro-search/index.html (CNN)]\n*[[Kogalymavia Flight 9268]]\n**Airlines including [[Emirates (airline)|Emirates]], [[Lufthansa]] and [[Air France]] refuse to fly over the [[Sinai Peninsula]] until the cause of the crash is known. Neradko added it was too soon to determine what caused Saturday's horrific crash. The document has been amended 17 times revising 113 of the 177 articles. [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/01/us-turkey-election-davutoglu-speech-idUSKCN0SQ2GH20151101 (Reuters)] [http://www.kuna.net.kw/ArticleDetails.aspx?id=2469026&language=en (Kuwait News Agency)] [http://odatv.com/n.php?n=177-maddeden-113u-degisti-hangi-82-anayasasi-1110111200 (ODATV)]\n**[[Civil disorder|Protesters]] clashed with [[General Directorate of Security|police]] outside the headquarters of the [[Peoples' Democratic Party (Turkey)|People's Democratic Party]] (HDP) in the [[Kurds]]' main city of [[Diyarbak\u0131r]] in southeastern [[Turkey]] as it became evident [[President of Turkey|President]] [[Recep Tayyip Erdo\u011fan]] and the AKP were getting a solid majority and would return to power. The tumult spread to other major cities and towns in the [[Turkish Kurdistan|Kurdish heartland]]. The HDP won 10.7 percent of the vote; the party holds 59 of its 80 seats in the [[Grand National Assembly of Turkey|parliament]]. [http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/162420/World/Region/Clashes-in-Turkeys-main-Kurdish-city-after-vote.aspx ''(Al-Ahram)''] [https://www.wsj.com/articles/angry-kurds-police-clash-as-vote-bolsters-turkish-president-1446427280 (Wall Street Journal)]\n\n*[[Azerbaijani parliamentary election, 2015]]\n**[[Azerbaijanis|Azeri voters]] go to the polls for a parliamentary election,  which [[Azerbaijan|Azerbaijan President]] [[Ilham Aliyev|Ilham Aliyev's]] ruling [[New Azerbaijan Party]] is widely expected to win since the [[Musavat|The M\u00fcsavat (Equality) Party]] and other [[Azerbaijanis|Azerbaijani]] mainstream opposition [[List of political parties in Azerbaijan|parties]] are boycotting. The [[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]] (OSCE) is not monitoring the election because the restrictions imposed by the authorities make credible poll monitoring impossible. [http://tass.ru/en/world/833248 (TASS)] [https://www.reuters.com/article/2015/11/01/azerbaijan-election-idUSL8N12W03W20151101 (Reuters)]\n*[[Attacks on secularists in Bangladesh]]\n**Teachers, writers and students lead a protest rally in [[Dhaka]] against the recent killings and attacks on secular authors and publishers in [[Bangladesh]]. The country's April 2015 law requires all new [[smartphone]]s sold to those 18 and under have software parents can use to monitor their kids' [[social media]] activity. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-36013862 (BBC)]\n\n;Business and economics\n*[[Financial crisis of 2007\u201308|2008 financial crisis]]\n**[[Goldman Sachs]] agrees to pay $5.06 billion to settle allegations that it sold packages of shoddy mortgages prior to the global financial crisis.. The [[United States Department of Justice|U.S. Justice Department]] settlement includes a $2.385 billion civil penalty, and $1.8 billion for distressed borrowers and communities affected by the [[Subprime mortgage crisis|housing crisis]]. [https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/business/wp/2016/04/11/goldman-sachs-pays-5-billion-to-settle-allegations-it-sold-shoddy-mortgages-prior-to-financial-crisis/ (''The Washington Post'')] [http://www.upi.com/Business_News/2016/04/11/Goldman-Sachs-to-pay-5-billion-in-settlement-over-financial-crisis/2151460387785/?spt=sec&or=bn (UPI)]\n\n;Disasters and accidents\n*[[2014\u201316 El Ni\u00f1o event]]\n**A severe [[Heat wave|heat wave]] grips [[Malaysia]] as much of [[Southeast Asia]] struggles with unusually  hot and dry weather created by the [[El Ni\u00f1o]] season. Temperatures in Malaysia soared above 37\u00b0C, prompting more than 250 schools to close. [http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/04/severe-heatwave-grips-malaysia-160411102328907.html (''Al Jazeera'')]\n\n;International relations\n*G7 foreign ministers meeting\n**[[John Kerry]], along with the other [[Group of Seven (G7)]] foreign ministers,  laid wreaths   at  [[Japan|Japan's]] [[Hiroshima Peace Memorial Museum]] to the victims of the [[Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki#Hiroshima|1945 U.S. nuclear attack]]. Kerry  is  the first [[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]]  to visit the memorial. [[Speaker of the United States House of Representatives|Then-U.S. Speaker of the House of Representatives]] [[Nancy Pelosi]] was previously the highest-ranking U.S. official to visit the memorial, in 2008. The [[Hiroshima]] foreign ministers meeting is part of the preparations for the [[42nd G7 summit]] the end of next month at Japan's [[Kashiko Island]], [[Shima, Mie|Shima]], [[Mie Prefecture]]. [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-g7-japan-idUSKCN0X802S (Reuters)] [http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asiapacific/hiroshima-in-focus-as-top/2681586.html (Channel NewsAsia)]\n*[[Houthi insurgency in Yemen]], [[Yemeni Crisis (2011\u2013present)]]\n**[[Ismail Ould Cheikh Ahmed]], the [[United Nations]] special envoy for [[Yemen]], says he welcomes the tentative truce that started at midnight Yemen time.  The truce opens  unhindered access for relief aid to all of Yemen. Peace talks are set to start later this month. [http://www.rferl.org/content/kyrgyz-prime-minister-sariev-resigns/27666911.html (Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty)]\n*[[2016 Darfurian status referendum]]\n**Voting for a referendum begins in [[Darfur]], [[Sudan]]. Voters will be asked during the three-day referendum to decide on the permanent administrative status of the region. The choices are for the creation of a Darfur Region composed of the States of Darfur, or the retention of the status quo states system. Darfur is currently divided into five states. Voters will decide this week whether the area should go back to being one region, as it was until 1994. However, there are fears of voter apathy and if the referendum will be credible. [http://www.aljazeera.com/news/2016/04/darfur-referendum-held-fears-voter-apathy-160411060337405.html (''Al Jazeera'')]\n*The [[President of South Ossetia|President]] of the [[Georgia (country)|Georgian]] breakaway state of [[South Ossetia]] [[Leonid Tibilov]] announces his plan to hold a referendum on whether to become part of [[Russia]] or to keep its ''de facto'' independence before August of this year. This comes after South Ossetia signed various agreements further integrating the region with Russia. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-40496707 (BBC)]\n\n;International relations\n*[[North Korea and weapons of mass destruction]]\n**[[North Korea]] test-launches what is presumed to be its first [[intercontinental ballistic missile]] 933 kilometers  into the [[Sea of Japan]] within [[Japan]]'s [[Exclusive Economic Zone]]. An American expert theorizes the ICBM, which reached an altitude of 2,802 km, could potentially reach the U.S. state of [[Alaska]]. [http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-07-04/north-korea-launches-ballistic-missile%3A-south-korea/8676404 (ABC News Australia)] [http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2017-07/04/c_136416688.htm (Xinhua News Agency)] [https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-missiles-idUSKBN19P02W (Reuters)]\n\n*[[China\u2013India relations]], [[Bhutan\u2013China relations]] \n**Amid a stand-off between [[China]] and [[India]] over the [[List of territorial disputes#Asia and the Pacific|Doklam tri-junction]], China tells India that former Indian prime minister [[Jawaharlal Nehru]] accepted the [[Convention of Calcutta]] which China is using to support its territorial claims. Tensions have been rising between China and India and Bhutan over Doklam since China began constructing a road in the disputed territory in mid-June. [http://www.news18.com/news/world/nehru-accepted-1890-treaty-india-using-bhutan-to-cover-up-entry-china-1450635.html (News18)]\n\n;Law and crime\n*[[2016\u201317 Rohingya persecution in Myanmar]]\n**A mob of at least a hundred [[Rakhine people|Rakhine]] [[Buddhism|Buddhists]] in [[Sittwe]], [[Rakhine State]], [[Myanmar]], attack seven [[Rohingya people|Rohingya]] men from Dapaing Camp for [[internally displaced persons]], killing one and severely injuring another. The Rohingya men were being escorted by police to Sittwe's docks to purchase boats, but were attacked despite armed guards being present. The event coincided with a [[Gamma-ray burst#Short gamma-ray bursts|short gamma ray burst]] [[GRB 170817A]] detected by the [[Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope]], leading to [[SSS17a]], the immediate follow-up observations by the [[Hubble space telescope]] and numerous ground-based telescopes. This confirms the theory according to which [[neutron star collision|neutron star mergers]] are the cause of at least some short gamma-ray bursts. [https://www.ligo.caltech.edu/page/press-release-gw170817 (LIGO press release)][https://www.theverge.com/2017/10/16/16471616/gravitational-waves-ligo-virgo-neutron-stars-merger-multi-messenger-astronomy (''The Verge'')]\n*[[Wireless security]], [[KRACK]]\n**Researchers discover [[KRACK|a vulnerability]] in the [[WPA2]] protocol, leaving devices running [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS]], [[iOS]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]], [[Linux]] and [[OpenBSD]] operating systems vulnerable to attack over wireless connections. Wyoming'' rules in favor of a [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] [[Elk|elk]] hunter from [[Montana]] who was convicted for hunting {{nowrap|off-season}} in [[Bighorn National Forest]], deciding that the 1868 federal treaty between the [[Crow Nation]] and the [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. Government]] is still in force even after [[Wyoming]] became a state in 1890. The treaty gave tribe members hunting rights on \"unoccupied\" lands.
